author: wn.com
title: Composite Leading Indicators (CLI), OECD, October 2015 (OECD - Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) ...
text: (Source: OECD - Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) 08/10/2015 - Composite leading indicators (CLIs), designed to anticipate turning points in economic activity relative to trend, show signs of a moderating growth outlook in most major economies. The CLI for the OECD area as a whole points to growth easing, with a loss of growth momentum anticipated in the United Kingdom and the United States, albeit from relatively high levels, andsigns of a more moderate easing of growth in Canada and Japan. In Germany and the Euro area as a whole, stable growth momentum is anticipated while in France and Italy the outlook is for firming growth. Among the major emerging economies, CLIs continue to point to a loss of growth momentum in China, and weak growth momentum in Brazil and Russia. Firminggrowth is expected in India. Do you need help with our data? Please consult: FAQs Methodological information Glossary for Composite Leading Indicators and Business Tendency Surveys OECD Business Cycle Analisys Database Watch also our short video explaining how the Composite Leading Indicators are compiled distributed by This content was issued by OECD - Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development on the 2015-10-08 and was initially posted on www.oecd.org. It was distributed, unedited and unaltered, by noodls on 2015-10-08 10:29:13 UTC. The original issuer is solely responsible for the accuracy of the information contained therein. (noodl: 30235843)
